title: Death toll from devastating Indonesia floods passes 900
byline: The death toll in Indonesia from recent flooding has passed 900, with hundreds still missing.

title: Staff and tourists among 23 killed in Goa nightclub fire, officials say
byline: At least 23 people have been killed in a fire at a popular nightclub in the coastal region of Goa, India, local officials say.

title: England and Scotland find out World Cup kick-off times
byline: England have been handed World Cup kick-off times which suit UK audiences - but Scotland fans face later finishes during next summer’s tournament.

title: Hotline introduced for public complaints on essential services
byline: The Office of Commissioner General for Essential Service has introduced the hotline number 1904 to facilitate public complaints related to accessibility of essential services.

title: Kohli breaks Jayasuriya record, closes in on Sachin’s ODI milestone
byline: Virat Kohli has overtaken Sanath Jayasuriya to claim the second-most Player of the Series awards in ODI history, moving to 12-just three behind Sachin Tendulkar’s all-time record of 15.

title: Verstappen beats Norris and Piastri to pole
byline: Red Bull’s Max Verstappen beat his McLaren title rivals Lando Norris and Oscar Piastri to pole position with an imposing performance in qualifying for the Abu Dhabi Grand Prix.

title: Man shot dead in Dehiwala
byline: A 34-year-old resident of Dehiwala was shot dead by an unidentified gunman near the A Quarters Sports Ground a short while ago.

title: Provide special allowance to public servants: UNP
byline: UNP Chairman Vajira Abeywardena today called for the payment of a special allowance to public servants, especially field officers, stating that such a thing is important at a time of a disaster.

title: Lanka Ashok Leyland donates seven utility vehicles to support relief, recovery efforts
byline: Lanka Ashok Leyland has donated seven essential utility vehicles valued at more than Rs. 65 million to support relief, recovery and rehabilitation efforts across Sri Lanka, the Indian High Commission said.

title: At least 11 killed in South Africa mass shooting
byline:
At least 11 people have been killed in a mass shooting at a hostel in South Africa.
Fourteen others were wounded when gunmen stormed the venue in Saulsville township, west of the capital Pretoria, early on Saturday. A three-year-old is among the dead.

title: Powers of local authorities must be enforced to prevent similar disasters in future: President
byline: While noting that natural disasters such as floods, storms and landslides cannot be prevented, President Anura Kumara Dissanayake emphasised today that the loss of lives and property can be minimised.

title: Pakistan legend Akram hails 'incredible' Starc after Ashes heroics
byline: Legendary Pakistan pacer Wasim Akram believes even more is to come from Australia’s ’’incredible’’ veteran Ashes wrecking ball Mitchell Starc.

title: Sri Lanka’s airports now fully operational; AASL
byline: Sri Lanka’s airports continue to operate without disruption, with all scheduled flights running smoothly despite the recent adverse weather conditions, Airport and Aviation Services (Sri Lanka) (Private) Limited (AASL) said.

title: Tamil Nadu donates 950 metric tonnes of essential relief items
byline: The Tamil Nadu government has donated 950 metric tonnes of essential relief items to people affected due to Cyclone Ditwah in Sri Lanka.

title: Disaster relief shipment from Switzerland arrives in Sri Lanka
byline: An aircraft carrying 2.6 metric tons of disaster relief aid from Switzerland arrived at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA), Katunayake, this morning (06).

title: Health Promotion Bureau warns of eye infections in crowded places following floods
byline: The Health Promotion Bureau warns people to be on the alert for eye infections, which can easily spread in places where people gather following the recent floods.

title: Rare dugong carcass washes ashore in Mannar
byline: The Department of Wildlife Conservation reported that the carcass of a rare dugong (Dugong dugon) was found washed ashore on the Pesalai beach along the Mannar coast on November 30.

title: DMT to launch mobile services to assist owners of flood-submerged vehicles
byline: The Department of Motor Traffic (DMT) announced that it will introduce district-wise mobile services to assist vehicle owners whose documents were lost or damaged after their vehicles were submerged in the recent floods.

title: Magazine Prison inmates donate today’s lunch to flood affected
byline: The inmates of the New Magazine Prison, Colombo have donated their lunch today to the people in Colombo, who were affected by the Ditwah cyclone.

title: Rehan Jayawickrama resigns from Samagi Jana Balawegaya
byline: Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) Weligama electoral organiser and former Mayor of Weligama Rehan Jayawickrama has tendered his resignation from the party.

title: Taxpayers granted grace period to file Income Tax Returns
byline: The Inland Revenue Department has further extended the deadline for all registered income tax payers to submit their Income Tax Returns for the Assessment Year 2024/2025 till December 31.

title: No institution had prepared for recent disaster: President
byline: No institution was prepared to face the recent disaster, as none had drawn up plans to respond to an emergency of such scale, President Anura Kumara Dissanayake told Parliament yesterday.

title: FIFA World Cup 2026 Draw - Groups, Teams, Format
byline: Sri Lankan football fans have been following the global build up to the FIFA World Cup 2026 draw, and the long wait ended in Washington, DC where the tournament groups were officially revealed. After weeks of political attention surrounding the event and the presence of United States President Donald Trump, the focus finally returned to the sport.

title: Tea industry hit hard; damaged machinery will take months to function again
byline: In the wake of the natural disaster that took place in Sri Lanka last week, the tea industry was hit hard and may take months to recover to normal as machinery that has been destroyed has to be sent abroad to repair and damage to roads may affect the distribution of tea exports, according to an official from the Colombo Tea Traders Association.

title: Legendary architect Frank Gehry dies aged 96
byline:
Frank Gehry, one of the most influential architects of the last century, has died aged 96.
Gehry was acclaimed for his avant garde, experimental style of architecture. His titanium-covered design of the Guggenheim Museum in Bilbao, Spain, catapulted him to fame in 1997.

title: Bambalapitiya Marine Drive accident injures five
byline: Five persons were injured and hospitalised following a road accident on the Bambalapitiya Marine Drive at around 2:30 a.m. today.

title: Boat seized with ICE, heroin in Kalpitiya
byline: The Sri Lanka Navy seized a boat that was transporting heroin and Crystal methamphetamine (ICE) in the seas off Kalpitiya last night.

title: ‘Ayubowan’, king coconuts and bananas to reassure visitors
byline: The Sri Lanka Institute of National Tourist Guide Lecturers (SLINTGL) has issued an emotional appeal to the public, urging citizens to go beyond standard hospitality by greeting every tourist with a warm ‘Ayubowan’ or offering simple gestures like a king coconut or banana, to help the industry rebound from recent weather setbacks.

title: CBSL requests all licensed banks to provide temporary debt relief to affected individuals, businesses
byline: The Central Bank of Sri Lanka (CBSL) has requested all licensed banks to provide temporary debt relief and fresh financial support to individuals and businesses whose income has been directly affected due to the Ditwah cyclone.

title: Myanmar flight carrying disaster relief arrives
byline: A Myanmar Air Force flight (Y8) arrived at the Katunayake Air Force camp last night carrying disaster relief.

title: Spill gates of seven major reservoirs opened
byline: The Department of Irrigation said that spill gates of seven major reservoirs have been opened due to rising water levels following recent rainfall.

title: PHIs bust distribution of flood-damaged rice
byline: Public Health Inspectors (PHIs) have uncovered an illegal racket involving the processing and distribution of flood-damaged rice deemed unfit for consumption in the Harispattuwa area of the Kandy District.

title: Govt to launch cyclone housing damage assessment tomorrow
byline: The Ministry of Housing, Construction, and Water Supply said that the assessment of damage to houses caused by Cyclone Ditwah will begin tomorrow. The process will be carried out by a committee appointed under the Presidential Secretariat and will focus on identifying households eligible for government support.

title: North-East monsoon strengthens, showers expected
byline: The Department of Meteorology said that the north-east monsoon is gradually establishing over Sri Lanka, bringing increased rainfall to several regions.

title: Death toll from devastating Indonesia floods passes 900
byline: The death toll in Indonesia from recent flooding has passed 900, with hundreds still missing.

title: Pakistan legend Akram hails 'incredible' Starc after Ashes heroics
byline: Legendary Pakistan pacer Wasim Akram believes even more is to come from Australia’s ’’incredible’’ veteran Ashes wrecking ball Mitchell Starc.

title: Expedite disaster relief, rebuilding without saying ’ane please’: Sajith
byline: The government should expedite the disaster relief and rebuilding without saying ’ane please’, Leader of the Opposition Sajith Premadasa said today.

title: U.S. Air Force team arrives to provide American airlift capability
byline: Two C-130J Super Hercules and Airmen from the U.S. Air Force 36th Contingency Response Group (CRG) arrived to provide American airlift capability in support of Sri Lanka’s Cyclone Ditwah response, a statement from the U. U. embassy said.

title: Weather-related death toll soars to 627
byline: The death toll from the severe weather conditions that swept across Sri Lanka in recent days has risen to 627, the Disaster Management Centre (DMC) said.

title: Police Sergeant injured in accidental firearm discharge
byline: A police sergeant was injured this morning when a firearm accidentally discharged inside the Malabe Police Station. The incident occurred while the officer was checking the firearm.

title: Opposition must be sued for being silent on weather warning: Deputy Minister
byline: Claiming that the opposition had kept mum on the warnings of an impending cyclone for two weeks from November 12 as they claimed, Deputy Minister Mahinda Jayasinghe said today the opposition must be sued for failing to inform the government of the warning of an impending cyclone if they were aware of it from November 12.

title: Lando Norris wins first F1 world championship title at Abu Dhabi GP
byline: A tearful Lando Norris claimed his maiden Formula One world drivers’ title in Abu Dhabi on Sunday, ending Max Verstappen’s four-year reign.
